alert.note: Alert for Dyer; Gibson; Obion (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 29 at 12:09PM CDT until March 30 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Obion River near Obion For the Obion River...including Obion...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Obion River near Obion. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Farmland near the river is flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday the stage was 34.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CDT Wednesday was 34.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 28.8 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 34.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/memphis. The next statement will be issued as conditions warrant.
